intro: Mentha pascuorum, commonly known as field mint, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, characterized by its square stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, pale blue or purple flowers that bloom from June to August. Its aromatic leaves contain essential oils, giving it a minty scent and making it useful in herbal remedies. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and along stream banks.
